Class ScrollWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.World
      • ScrollWorld
  • public abstract class ScrollWorld
extends greenfoot.World
    A world which has the possibility to scroll over a really big area. That big area is called the big space, It scrolls over it using a camera. The camera's location starts as x=half width, y=half height of the world. It can't get outside of the big space.

    The background is always scrolling, you don't have to do anything for it. Just make a background like you always do in your scenarios, and this scenario will scroll over it. The only note is that the method World.setBackground(greenfoot.GreenfootImage) is replaced by setNewBackground(greenfoot.GreenfootImage).

    The world supports adding ScrollActors in 2 ways:

  • Adding it in the regular way, which means that it can go off screen and come back on screen.
  • Adding a camera follower, which means that it will move just as much as the camera does. So if you add it to the center of the screen, it will always be there (except for when you change it yourself).
    • IMPORTANT NOTE: if your Actor isn't a subclass of ScrollActor, it will looklike it is a camera follower.
Version:
2.1.2
Author:
Sven van Nigtevecht

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScrollWorld

        public ScrollWorld​(int width,
                   int height,
                   int cellSize,
                   int fullWidth,
                   int fullHeight)
        Create a new ScrollWorld.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the scroll world in cells.
        height - The height of the scroll world in cells.
        cellSize - The size of the cells (in pixels).
        fullWidth - The total width of the world. That means, objects can't move further than this limit.
        fullHeight - The total height of the world. That means, objects can't move further than this limit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the arguments is smaller or equal to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • setNewBackground

        public void setNewBackground​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage background)
        Sets the background of the world. This will also initialize everything to make the background scroll, something the normal World.setBackground(greenfoot.GreenfootImage) method doesn't.

      • addCameraFollower

        public void addCameraFollower​(ScrollActor cameraFollower,
                              int x,
                              int y)
        Adds an object which will follow the camera. The location is seen from the camera, not from the big space.
        Parameters:
        cameraFollower - The object that will be added to the world as a camera follower.
        x - The x coördinate seen from the camera where the object will be added.
        y - The y coördinate seen from the camera where the object will be added.
        See Also:
        #addObject(ScrollActor, int, int)

      • addObject

        public void addObject​(greenfoot.Actor object,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Adds an object to the the world. If the given object is a ScrollActor or a subclass of it, the x and y coördinates are in the big space.
        Overrides:
        addObject in class greenfoot.World
        Parameters:
        object - The object that will be added to the world.
        x - The x coördinate in the world where the object will be added.
        y - The y coördinate in the world where the object will be added.
        See Also:
        addCameraFollower(ScrollActor, int, int)

      • removeObject

        public void removeObject​(greenfoot.Actor object)
        Removes an object from the world.
        Overrides:
        removeObject in class greenfoot.World
        Parameters:
        object - The object that will be removed from the world. This can either be a camera follower, or just a regular object.

      • setCameraLocation

        public void setCameraLocation​(int x,
                              int y)
        Moves the camera to a particular location. Note that this is a location in the big space.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x coördinate of the camera.
        y - The new y coördinate of the camera.

      • setCameraDirection

        public void setCameraDirection​(int degrees)
        Sets the direction the camera is facing. It doesn't change anything you see, but it makes it possible to use the moveCamera(int) method.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The new rotation in degrees.
        See Also:
        turnCamera(int), moveCamera(int)

      • turnCamera

        public void turnCamera​(int amount)
        Turns the camera. It doesn't change anything you see, but it makes it possible to use the moveCamera(int) method.
        Parameters:
        amount - The number of degrees the camera will turn clockwise. If this is negative, it will turn counter-clockwise.
        See Also:
        setCameraDirection(int), moveCamera(int)

      • moveCamera

        public void moveCamera​(int amount)
        Moves the camera forward to the direction it's facing (to go backwards, enter a negative number).
        Parameters:
        amount - The number of cells the camera will move. When this is negative, the camera will move forward.
